I suspect you're right, there's not really a need to allow non-member
posts; I'm betting there hasn't been one in a very long time.

alternate_dph wrote:
> Right now, settings are such that non-members can post with posts by
 non-members being moderated.  That's become problematic.  Everyday,
 this group recieves quite a few pieces of spam coming from
 non-members, and frankly I don't have the time or inclination to track
 down where the spam is originating from.  Deleting spam won't be a
 problem except every 2-3 days, it's 12 pending messages that are spam
 waiting to be deleted.
